headline: Apple Loses Title of World's Most Valuable Company as China Tariffs Loom
summary: Apple lost its title as the world's most valuable public company on Tuesday after the stock slid the day before steep tariffs on Chinese imports were scheduled to go into effect.

headline: Apple Exported More Than $17 Billion of iPhones From India Last Year
summary: Apple exported more than $17 billion of iPhones from India last year, a rapid expansion that is set to help the company offset new tariffs announced by the Trump administration.  India’s smartphone exports jumped by more than 50% in the 12 months that ended in March compared to the previous year, the country’s technology minister said Tuesday.  The Wall Street Journal reported Monday that Apple plans to send more iPhones to the U.S. from India to offset the high cost of China tariffs.

raw.headline: Apple Exported More Than $17 Billion of iPhones From India Last Year
raw.summary: Apple exported more than $17 billion of iPhones from India last year, a rapid expansion that is set to help the company offset new tariffs announced by the Trump administration.  India’s smartphone exports jumped by more than 50% in the 12 months that ended in March compared to the previous year, the country’s technology minister said Tuesday.  The Wall Street Journal reported Monday that Apple plans to send more iPhones to the U.S. from India to offset the high cost of China tariffs.

headline: Tesla, Amazon, and Apple forfeit gains after fleeting Magnificent 7 stock rally
summary: The trade-war selloff took a breather earlier on Tuesday, buoying Big Tech firms including Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA), Meta (META), and Microsoft (MSFT), after a mixed day on Monday and two especially gnarly days last week wiped $1.8 trillion off the market value of leading tech stocks.

headline: Magnificent Seven Stocks Waver
summary: The market is wobbling again, and the Magnificent Seven tech stocks are being swept along.    In recent trading, the stocks varied from a 1.3% loss for Apple to a near-2% gain for Nvidia.   The septet had added nearly $500 billion in market cap, according to Dow Jones Market Data, only for a large chunk of those gains to evaporate.
